author: Loganwan
title: Can't wait for more
review:
If this is what the rest of the farm equipment is going to look like, I am really excited.

This is a really well designed vehicle.   It looks very accurate to a real modern tractor, with the great function of a scoop on the back.  Hopefully we will see some cows that need a little cleaning up after.

The only area that I would say is lacking is the fact that you have to dismantle the top and one of the windows in order to get the driver in.  It is only a minor problem that is even smaller when looking at the great design over all.

It is going to be a great workhorse for the farm sets to come.

author: hustla187
title: Great Design
review: The thing that really gets my attention is the design of this set. It looks like a modern tractor from front to back. The interior of the tractor is pretty good too. This set is probably one of the best of 2009 so far.

author: cassidyarch
title: What a great Tractor!
review:
It's a beauty! Nice shape, and great pieces. A real charmer!

I love these new stubby windscreens--this comes with two. This is the most "Airtight" cockpit I've seen in ages. Those Mars Mission guys wish they had it this good. 

Minifig has a great pair of green overalls, printed on the back as well. 5/5

author: jamal_lts
title: Lets be carrying the load guys!!
review:
This set has lots of playability. The back of the tractor has a loader which is very well designed. It doesn't droop down easily when there's weight on it. 

The size of the model is just right. Size for my CITY vehicles are very important to me. 

The best part is you can have the tractor be fitted with other components like a front loader bucket or a tow bed for other functions of a tractor.

for the price of this set, its real a good buy!

author: _obelix_
title: Fantastic little set!
review:
This is the first of the new sets that i bought in 2009, and i have to say it is great. The construction of this little tractor is a simple job, but that doesn't diminish its awesomeness one bit. Its true to the form of a true tractor with only of small number of technic elements, which, by the way, are nicely put into construction so you almost don't see them in the final stage. The construction is very sturdy built, which is also true to the realistic portrait of a real tractor. A farmer figure is nice, and his shovel is a bonus. There are only three stickers for this set, which are very small, and are easy to put on right.

All in all set with a pure 5!

author: lotographia
title: John Brick.
review:
Okay, while I'm not particularly excited by the idea that it's just a tractor... I do have to acknowledge that it's a marvellous little tractor. And while farms themselves do not interest me... I'm glad that lego are working on a theme that isn't just police, firemen or emergency rescue. I'd rather have a tractor than any number of police cars and fire trucks - it evokes a kind of peaceful rural scene rather than a hectic dangerous inner city adventure.

For some reason the back of this tractor has a connection to attach trailers too, I'm not sure what you'd put there or how you'd get it around the big scoop. It's a nice touch though, whatever you're supposed to do with it.

author: Monty
title: A VERY GOOD CASE
review:
This is a cracking little set which reminds me of a Case tractor. It really looks the part and comes with a working lifting carrier at the rear as well as a towing point. The wheels and tyres on the rear axle looked like new parts to me so these will be good for other models where the wide large wheel/tyre combo is not appropriate. The farm minifig is good too – especially the overalls. I have mine driving rather than holding the shovel it comes with – which is in the spares box.

My only slight criticism is that some of the parts could have been in better colours for even more realism. Again I have modified the set, mainly just changing colours and adding mirrors and an exhaust stack/silencer brick, which I feel, enhances an already great set.

Price is about right in my view, but you can get something off by buying it in Tesco.

Based on my evaluating criteria of looks/appearance, minifigs, working features/playability and price this has to rate a maximum score and if you read any of my previous reviews you will see I do not give these out lightly.

I bought this to compliment the Combine Harvester 7636, which has now been modified from the set. I need to make a grain trailer to go with the tractor, but have not done this yet. If not already there they should all appear on Brickshelf when I get time.

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: Highly Appreciated
review:
LEGO has made another excellent set at a reasonable price.
Box : 5/5
Very interesting CGI pic of the tractor and the farmer with his shovel. At the top is the farmer with the 1:1 scale, rightside is the choking hazard blah blah blah that nobody ever reads. Leftside is a panoramic view of the front picture, and backward contains 3 images about the tractor. I guess you already know what's at the bottom part of the box.

Instructions : 4/5
Just standard instructions booklet, nothing new.

Building : 5/5
Surprisingly, this set is a great fun to build, despite it's small size. Also, I love how LEGO designed the "cockpit" for the farmer.

Playability : 4/5
Nothing special, you just move tractor here and there, lower and rise the back compartment. However, it would be great if you have a complete Farm collection.

Compare With Price : 5/5
In Indonesia, it's priced for IDR 196,900 which is equal to US$ 20,95. This is a pretty fair price (if not compared to the US price). I give this section a five because I got this set for a 15%+10% discount at a local LEGO fair.

Overall : 5/5
Great details, nice minifig, and 2 big tires really make up some reasons for you to buy this one. But, the lack of more accesories is a little setback. Overall, a fine little set to buy and play!

Pros : 
Rare Minifig
Detailed Tractor
2 Big Tires
A Shovel

Cons :
Should have more accesories (maybe scythe or other farming stuff)

New pieces : None
Unique pieces : 2 big tires and 2 big velg.

Regards,
Shadow Crawler

author: indykid
title: Cool Little Tractor
review:
I got this tractor for Christmas so I'm not sure how much it was... but it's a cool little set. I'm not really into the Farm theme but then I got this set and I've been looking at them and they are pretty cool.

Pros:

  • Tractor with a great design
  • Farmer minifigure w/ shovel (matches my Farmer set)

Cons:

  • Funny way of putting the farmer in the tractor
  • Stickers

I'm not really sure what the thing on the back is but I like to put yellow bricks in it for hay of putting my other farmer minifigure in it because he has no mode of transportation. This is a great set an I highly reccommend it to anyone whether they like Farm sets or not!

author: Night_City_Dream
title: Simply excellent
review:
I've bought all the Farm sets and I think this set is the best.

It comes at a fair price and a fair box - not very big, which I appreciate.

The set has only 1 minifig but it's enough for such size of set. The man torso is new, and very nice. It has enough accessories, in my opinion.

The tractor itself is excellent. It is so well designed that I really think absence of doors is unnoticeable! It looks veru much like a real tractor. And, what is important to me personally is that it is moderately scaled and fits easily to the Lego City System.

There is one small disadvantage - the basket often comes off but I don't think it's so eye-catching.

So, 5/5.

author: LegoCoastalPatrol
title: A Very Rugged Machine…
review:
After purchasing and building the 4WD with Horse Trailer (7635) and reviewing it here on Brickset, I closed my review by stating that I wouldn’t be expanding the Farm line in my collection … until I walked through Argos on Boxing Day and saw a basket full of these tractors with a small discount applied.   I am really glad I picked one of these up as it really is a great set; I am very impressed with how realistic it is.   The other sets in this series do not interest me so I think I can safely say that this will close my Farm collection, unless another tractor is released!

Construction was a very pleasant 20 minutes, accurately applying the decals and making sure the build was as recommended in the manual.   The tractor is presented in a bright red colour scheme; it looks like it has just come out of the showroom, if showrooms for agricultural equipment exist?!   The chassis area is a mixture of black and grey parts along with white wheels and deep-tread tyres.   Attached to the sides of the tractor are vents, vertical exhaust pipe and steps allowing ‘access’ to the cab.   The bonnet is a simple curved arrangement which meets the windscreen on the all-transparent cab.   Two simple headlights are provided as are two rear lights in red.   The cab area is very small and seats just one minifig (he is supplied) running alongside the cab are the red wheel arches.   Behind the cab a towing bracket is provided and either side of this are the two brackets which allow the grey bucket / scoop to move in various ways (up and down and at various angles) presumably to allow feed to be spread or for the moving of items around the farm.   

The minifig wears green overalls and a red sweater; he also has a blue baseball cap on and looks to be happy in his job.   He comes with a shovel; unfortunately there is no bracket on the tractor to hold this so it has gone into the spares box.   

I think it’s a pity that to gain access to the cab the rear windscreen and roof have to be removed, perhaps the tractor could have been open-backed as many tractors are?   But that is the only negative aspect of the set in my opinion, the decals are small and discreet and do not cross more than one brick although I doubt I’ll be dismantling this set for a long time.  I am even toying with buying a second set and ‘weathering’ it to make it look like it has been in use for some time!

For the price its a great buy; I got mine from Argos where it was slightly reduced, however I have ordered the Single Drum Roller also from Argos as that is on 'proper' sale.

author: aplbomr79
title: Small Case
review:
Overview 4/5

This is an excellent build and resembles a Case Tractor.  It is a small tractor however, not nearly as impressive as the Ford/New Holland included in the Farm Set.  Everything is as expected, the major negative is that the only way to get inside is to lift off both the roof and one of the windshields.

The most impressive feature on this small Case is that it is compatible with the hay wagon from the Farm Set (7637-1) - and you don't even have to remove the rear dump attachment!

Build: 4/5

The build takes a leisurely 20 minutes without much to get in the way.  Stickers are the only reason this part has been downgraded to 4 Bricks.

Parts: 4/5

There are no new pieces, no unique pieces.  However, there was room for more tools or even some 'dirt' for the dump.

Playability: 5/5

This is an excellent piece from Lego and although it is too small to be considered a masterpiece, it is a very nice set.  It seamlessly fits right in with farm life.  The MiniFig seems very happy with the machine, so I have no complaints.  Again, the trailers and implements from the other tractors in the farm series are completely compatible - way to go Lego!

Value: 3/5

I picked this set up at Toys'R'Us for $14.99usd.  The total price may not be much of a shock until you see that it is over $0.17usd per piece.  That makes this a relatively costly purchase.

Negatives aside, this is definitely worth picking up, especially if you can get it at a discount.  I will be cruising the local TRU for clearance prices...

author: av8r1973
title: Realistic addition to my farm theme - nice addition, at that.
review:
This has been sitting on my wish list for a while, since I haven't seen it in any stores here in Taiwan.  It finally showed up relatively close to US retail prices, so it made it's way home with me.  I have the SUV with horse trailer, Pig Farm and Farmer, so this fits nicely into the rural portion of my city.  Next is the big farm.

My 3yo and 5yo built this in about 10 minutes with almost no guidance.  They have a lot of building experience, but there was nothing new about it.  The rear bucket has some interesting build techniques for a small kit and I was surprised (and happy) to see that.  My 5yo worked right through that.  Cool.  The rear bucket dumps and lowers, but it also falls off very easily.  I hope that with some exercise, the joints will loosen up a bit.

The tractor is a little smaller than the Pig Farm tractor, and much smaller than the one in the big farm, but it's not unusual for real farms to have multiple tractors around - the right tool for the job.  As another reviewer wrote, it does resemble a good old Case tractor.  Minimal use of stickers was nice - could have done without any.

A happy little minifig farmer that matches the other minifig farmers was nice.  Would have been nice to have a little variety since it's hard to tell which kit the minifigs were originally attached to.

The rear fenders and the dump bucket were new components for me, but the rest are standard.

A nice feature is that the tractor tows the horse trailer and the Pig Farm trailer very nicely. I am sure it wasn't accidental.  It's great to see some compatibility in the City theme, I hope it carries through with other subthemes.

As for the price, it's a bit much per piece, but there aren't a whole lot of pieces.  Some hay bales or some new farmer accessory (small dirt/manure pile or load of apples/corn) would have made the kit a bit more of a value.

author: Cpt_Crandall
title: Well designed small set
review: I really like this set. I am working on building a whole town (see owned), and I really love this tractor, it is minimalistic yet really sharp and clever in my opinion. Kudos to whoever thought this one up and put it together. In my opinion the whole new (2008-2011) town line is really nice.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: Good Price, Good Set, Doesn't Fit Into My City
review:
Hello again and I have set 7634 Tractor just bought it great little set price should be cheaper but its Technic bricks at the back so?

 

Parts

                                      The SURPRISINGLY BIG wheels is the star of this set, while the Technic bricks, side panels, and the driver's cab windows finish this set.

 

Build

                                      Expert builder, so easy. WARNING TO NEWBIES! Be careful when assembling back part.

 

Finished Size

                                      Pretty great but normal size for a 1 plastic bag build set.

 

Model

                                      Its great, the back loader is great and fits to a farm well. It has a small set of stairs [1x2 slope grill riged bricks] to get into the cab. New and great, bright red colourscheme. ONLY 3 STICKERS!

 

Story Corner

                                      I saw a video in YouTube about a LEGO plane crash and they used a tractor [from the Farm set] to pick up debris. I bought this and did the same thing, thats why it doesn't fit into my city. Being an airport property, this is my 2nd Farm System set to date, first was 7566 Farmer.

 

Conclusion

                                      I bought this on a clearance sale, so get this [almost] discontinued set before it dissapears.

author: Mickitat
title: One of the best sets of 2009
review:
This is one of the best sets of 2009. It is next to perfect, really.
The model of the tractor is just right, the proportions, the color scheme, the details like the steps . While it has everything it needs to represent a typical tractor, it is not overburdend like it's larger brother from 7637 (Farm) and looks far better than the one from 7684 (Pig farmer and tractor). The hopper is a nice addition, it adds playability without adding loads of pieces to make the set more expensive.
This certainly is the best of the farm sets and overall one of my favourite sets of the last years. While it is a bit overpriced if you pay full retail, it is also a great gift for children's birthdays.
